Articles.Content:
Hooray!!! My first add-on is now available. Saturn-V for "real solar system." Supplements targeted exclusively at "real solar system," without this , it just will not fit in the hangar :-). The rocket has no S-IVB, Apollo Lunar Module (they are in preparation), but is able to remove more than 80 tons into orbit by the F-1 engines from "1096bimu",I am very grateful to him for what he allowed to use his work my additions. I hope for your help in creating the most accurate parameters Rocket !.

Link to my add-on : https://www.dropbox.com/s/kie151lhglsttpe/Saturn%20V.zip

Link to the add-on "RSS" : http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55145-0-22-WIP-Alpha-Real-Solar-System-(Kerbin-Earth-rescale-etc)-v3

P.S. Please put my add-on to the spaceport and give a link to this page (all updates will happen here) I always produces an error :-(.thanks in advance.

License .

Edited January 21, 2014 by Piwa
:}

What is the most mass it can get into orbit? 190t?

EDIT: Didn't see the "80 tons" part. Duh . Just for realsies, the actual Saturn V can lift up to 190t I believe... Anyway you can do that? Great mod btw

The generally agreed-upon rule for real rockets in KSP is that all statistics be reduced to 64% of real life. JSYK

The real Saturn V could lift about 118mt to LEO and approx. 48mt to the Moon on a free return trajectory.

Yeah but this is for Real Solar System

Yay! An RSS scale Saturn V! I was literally just trying to make one of these with Stretchytanks, and it practically destroyed my CPU. I wasn't even full scale, it was only about 1600 tonnes.

EDIT: Wait a second. Is it compatible with real fuels? Kerosene first stage, LH2/LOX second and third?

Oh, my, I began to understand! S-IC Estimated parameters and Rocket flies well (Runs on Kerosene /LOX), but I have a question about S-II rather about its specific impulse, I turned on the Rocket Lh2/LOX,I can not understand her impulse, I set the parameters :

key = 0520

P.S. For earlier thanks a lot, but I'm really starting razbiratsya if I need your help for the Apollo lunar module, or I'll let you know, okay?

when will you finish zenit?

I reinstalled the system on the laptop and accidentally deleted all the textures and modelku with the rest = (. First I finish with the "Saturn" may then think recreate Zenith.

You can get a good overview of the J-2 (for both S-II and S-IVB) here:

http://www.astronautix.com/engines/j2.htm

so you'll want key = 0 421 and key = 1 200

You can get a good overview of the J-2 (for both S-II and S-IVB) here:

http://www.astronautix.com/engines/j2.htm

so you'll want key = 0 421 and key = 1 200

I've used these settings, they led me astray. S-IC flies great but S-II parameters "key = 0 421 and key = 1 200" does not go into orbit. . .

I've used these settings, they led me astray. S-IC flies great but S-II parameters "key = 0 421 and key = 1 200" does not go into orbit. . .

Actually the Vacuum isp of the S-II is 421 seconds. It's possible that your mass is wrong, or thrust is wrong. Make sure that thrust is 4,400, dry mass is 36t, and gross mass(fuel mass + dry mass) is...480t, if I'm not mistaken. Also, I'm not sure how you set up your configs, but the real Saturn V doesn't get to orbit on the second stage. It burns for 165 seconds on the third stage for it's final push to orbit.

Edited January 22, 2014 by Razorcane

pretty sure you mean 36 *tons* dry (Although my references mostly say 39t dry)

And, actually, this mod is an INT-21, so...dry mass would probably be higher. But Piwa is making the S-IVB, so best to leave S-II at ~36-39t dry.

Piwa, I'll try tomorrow with a ~100,000kg reference payload, and real stats.
